title: About
text:
Hi! My name is Zephan Shivam, and I’m a middle schooler from Austin, Texas.
You can see this project and much more at my github, https://github.com/PythonGoaler. If you want to contact me directly, you can contact me at my email, fearlessfan03 @ gmail dot com.
I made this project because I’m passionate about golf and I wanted to explore what affects the score the most. If you want to see details, here is my github repo - https://github.com/PythonGoaler/golf-score-analyzing
This project was created as a part of Kane’s Data Sciece Bootcamp - https://bootcamp.davidkane.info/.

title: What affects golf score the most?
text:
In this part we figure out whether the difficulty of long range putts, mid range putts, or short range puts makes more of a difference to the score.
























Slope of Mid Range Putts Graph:


-0.005602726 


Slope of Long Range Putts Graph:


-0.004722437

title: What affects golf score the most?
text:
What affects golf score the most?

By Zephan Shivam














Have you ever watched golf and wondered, “Sure, many things affect the score, but what affects it the most?” I sure have wondered that. So I created this project to answer that question. It takes data from datagolf.com, where all data is golf related, and analyzes what has the most effect on the score. In this project, we see that good putting on Par 3s and Par 4s seem to make the most difference on the score.

title: temp
text:
golf_data |> ggplot(mapping = aes(x = ott_sg, y = adj_score_to_par)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = “lm”, se = FALSE) + labs(title = “Relation between shots off the tee (drives) and score”, x= “Strokes gained off the tee (Driving)”, y = “Score”) + theme(plot.title = element_text(face = “bold”)) golf_data |> ggplot(mapping = aes(x = app_sg, y = adj_score_to_par)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = “lm”, se = FALSE) + labs(title = “Relation between approach shots and score”, x = “Strokes gained on the approach shot”, y = “Score”) +
theme(plot.title = element_text(face = “bold”)) golf_data |> ggplot(mapping = aes(x = arg_sg, y = adj_score_to_par)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = “lm”, se = FALSE) + labs(title = “Relation between shots around the green and score”, x = “Strokes gained around the green (short game)”, y = “Score”) + theme(plot.title = element_text(face = “bold”)) golf_data |> ggplot(mapping = aes(x = putt_sg, y = adj_score_to_par)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = “lm”, se = FALSE) + labs(title = “Relation between putting and score”, x = “Strokes Gained Putting”, y = “Score”) + theme(plot.title = element_text(face = “bold”))
